title.narrative: WASH Emergency Response to Displacement Affected Population in Monguno

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to respond to the WASH critical needs for the newly displaced families in Kuya, GSSSS and Water Board camps, Monguno Local Government Area (LGA), in line with the 90 Day Emergency Response Plan. The project, which will be implemented under a 6-month period, will cover a total of 2,736 households, 13,680 individuals (6,292M 7,388F) affected by the ongoing conflict and recent displacement with different WASH packages. Based on the gaps identified, the project will address the following gaps
Provision of clean water for drinking, personal hygiene and other domestic purposes through water trucking for a period of 60 days to a total of 8,000 individuals, with a per capita supply of 15 liters and through rehabilitation of one existing borehole. The borehole will improve water supply to the existing population, with a catchment of around 1,680 individuals Enhancing access to dignified sanitation facilities through construction of 65 new latrines and 65 bathing shelters, rehabilitation of 150 existing latrines, desludging to ensure proper operation and maintenance of full latrines and distribution of latrine cleaning materials. The emergency latrines will each serve a maximum of 50 individuals (ratio of 1:50). Refuse management through community mobilisation and distribution of 30 sanitation kits. Hygiene promotion, focusing on house to house visits, coupled with monthly distribution of soap to encourage proper hand washing practice and focusing on risky hygiene behaviors. Direct hygiene promotion will focus on 2400 Households, including those 1,200 HHs that will receive a monthly supply of soap for proper handwashing. Distribution of 500 Family Hygiene Kits, to vulnerable newly arrived Households, from the target beneficiary figure for hygiene promotion. A vulnerability criterion will be used in the beneficiary selection for this activity. Households that will receive soap distributed monthly may not be included in this distribution.
NRC’s project teams will work closely with the affected communities through their leaders and Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) representatives, as well as with the Shelter and Camp Management, the government representatives, and health and the other WASH sector partners.
